poem:
**Election Echoes**

In the marble's still embrace,
failures murmur secrets
—lapses of shadowed service.
Voices rise, though granite chills,
howled in the whispered
silence of old halls.

Fingers point, accusations
crack against the guarded
air, history waits
in the doorway,
arms crossed,
listening, again.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Secret Service report says multiple failures led to July Trump assassination attempt – live 7.48pm BST Kevin Moncla, a prominent election denier, is holding court on the marble steps just outside the Georgia state board of elections hearing room at the state capitol. Moncla described how state election officials had given him the cold shoulder after the 2020 election. Moncla and fellow activist Joe Rossi filed a complaint alleging that Fulton county had covered up". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Secret Service report says multiple failures led to July Trump assassination attempt – live 7.48pm BST Kevin Moncla, a prominent election denier, is holding court on the marble steps just outside the Georgia state board of elections hearing room at the state capitol. Moncla described how state election officials had given him the cold shoulder after the 2020 election. Moncla and fellow activist Joe Rossi filed a complaint alleging that Fulton county had covered up
